str2: When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.
Late, in the evening. From the same as opiso; late in the day; by extension, after the close of the day.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and poreuomai; to depart, be discharged, proceed, project.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
